title: A Long Article Part #1
content: A GitHub Pages site built from the /docs folder using an automated front-end build process with minified HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

title: A Long Article Part #2
content: As well as being minified, the JavaScript is transpiled to version ES2015 for wider browser support.

title: A Long Article Part #3
content: Site assets, such as images and favicons are copied across to the /docs folder during the build process. These files must be specified in the scripts section of the package.json file.

title: A Long Article Part #4
content: The original source files (index.js, files in js-modules/, style.css with nesting, etc.) remain in the project root for easier development and editing.

title: A Long Article Part #5
content: Important: When publishing to GitHub Pages, make sure the Pages setting is configured to serve from the /docs folder on the main branch.

title: A Long Article Part #6
content: A GitHub Pages site built from the /docs folder using an automated front-end build process with minified HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
